column5:
リ　リューディアさん!?
わぁ　久しぶり　元気だったぁ!?
column6:
R-Ryudia!?\n
Wow, it's been so long!\n
Are you doing okay!?

column5:
ええ……
私は今回　戦闘に参加できないけれど
できるだけの協力はするわ！
column6:
Yes...\n
While I'm unable to participate in the fighting this time, I'll support you as much as I can!

column5:
アイテムの調達は私にまかせて
ちょうだい！　それと私の方でも
他の仲間を捜してみるわ!!
column6:
Leave procuring items to me!\n
Additionally, I will search for your other allies!

column5:
アイテムと見つけた仲間は
すぐに転送するから安心して!!
column6: I'll warp any items or allies I find to you immediately, so fear not!

column5: ありがと！　リューディアさん!!

そういえば　ユナ
ママとは連絡をとってるんですか？
column6: By the way, Yuna, have you talked to your mother?
column7: NOTE: this dialogue appears after you go to a training area (or at least the first training planet) if you haven't gone to yuna's house since leaving earth

column5:
ううん……パパとママ今頃
どうしてるのかな…
column6: No...I wonder what Papa and Mama are up to right now...

column7: NOTE: this guy's art is the best by far, which may explain why they put it first in the list

column6:
Saki Kazamura (pen name)\n
(I want to be Lady Erika's manservant!)
column7:

column6:
Kazuhito Fukuda\n
(Cat ears are nice, but nurses are good too!\n
To Shiorin[nbsp]❤)

Ryouta Itou\n
(To Yunarin: Please be my friend.\n
Well, goodbye.)

Takashi Kagurazaka (pen name)\n

column6:
Fami2 (pen name)\n

column7:
NOTE: god, this is so small and blurry and messy that it's barely legible. here's what it looks like to me...

left:
滅多に
笑顔を見せない
君だけで、

right:
笑顔の[君?]は
[何?]よりも
[好?]いているよ。

column6:
Full Power (pen name)\n
(To Yuna and Yuri. A part-time job is fine, but watch out for Tokarev Goto, okay?)
column7: NOTE: ??? トカレフ後藤 is what appears to be written here, but it means nothing to me and doesn't seem to be a reference to anything that a search on the modern internet can turn up. possibly some in-joke among the friends of whatever 12-year-old japanese kid sent this in 25 years ago.

column5:
ユナ　あなたにファンレターが
来てるわよ！
column6: Yuna, there's a fan letter for you!

column5:
それと噂で聞いたんだけど
どこかの星で強い兵隊さんを
やっつけるといいことがあるそうよ！
column6:
Oh, and I heard a rumor...\n
Apparently, if you defeat strong troops on a planet somewhere, something good will happen!
column7: NOTE: hint on how to unlock yoko (win on the highest difficulty in one of the late-game training areas)

column5:
えっ　いいこと？
それってなんだろ………？
column6:
Huh? Something good?\n
What could that be...?

column5: じゃあ　ユナ　気をつけてね！
行って来ま〜す　ママ❤

ハイ
こちらリューディア…
お買い物なら私にまかせてね！
column6:
Yes, Ryudia here...\n
If you're going shopping, leave it to me!

column5:
また　後で
会いましょう！

column7: NOTE: coined term, literally "explosion light sphere". per the manual, the reading for this is ばっこうきゅう.
NOTE: キ一プ = "person one is dating while hoping for someone better"
NOTE: literally "psychic piece", as in a piece of rubble, i think?

column5: ファイブアニマルカンフー
デンジャラスパウダー

column7: NOTE: there's possibly a mistake in this attack's name -- this term would normally be written as 狂喜乱舞, which is pronounced the same

NOTE: and here we get in some trouble. way the hell back when in Yuna 1, there was a line 『女王様とお呼び！』, which is literally "call me queen" and is stereotypically associated with BDSM in Japan. i felt that this association wasn't intuitive in english and translated it as "grovel before your queen", etc. which was fine, except now for this game they've directly translated the line into english as a name for one of her abilities.

basically: lol, whatever
NOTE: the kanji compound yuna was tormented by in the first game
NOTE: emily's other abilities are similarly four-kanji compounds that are probably considered stereotypically complex, though i don't have the cultural knowledge for that

column5: ダイナマイトスローイン

column7: NOTE: literally "passing beam" -- the japanese refer to flashing one's headlights as "passing"

column5: イルミネーションレーザー

column7: NOTE: literally "crank in", a japanese-coined term to refer to the start of filming

column5: スポットライトビーム

column7: FIXME: "over" doesn't really sound right for this in english, should probably pick something better
FIXME: the only information i can find about リッガー has to do with an ultraman monster. though given that her other attack is a street fighter parody, that may be intentional.
NOTE: parodying the famous shouryuuken ("rising dragon fist") from street fighter

column5: エレクトロンブレイク
プラズマジェットビーム

Might of Heaven

NOTE: this is an hp recovery move, so i'm assuming it's "rebirth" and not "reverse"
NOTE: these are presumably referencing the "little boy" and "fat man" atomic bombs
NOTE: this is the "attack" used by the airlock when it opens. the japanese name is "hole out" in english, which is a little...off.
NOTE: this is actually another "wave motion" attack, but imo "surge" sounds better here

column5: ライトニングバスター

column7: NOTE: ally regular attacks start here

NOTE: over a year later and i still have no idea what this is actually supposed to mean
...oh, after going through the whole damn yuna artbook, there's a handwritten throwaway note on a piece of early concept art for polylina (p. 137):
「イイ子にしないとバッキンよ！」のかけ声で悪人を次々と倒していくぞ！！
"With a cry of 'If you don't behave yourself, there will be a bakkin [fine/penalty]!' she defeats bad guys one after another!!"
(this is probably specifically parodying sailor moon's "oshioki yo" catchphrase)
anyway, MORE FUTURE CORRECTIONS FOR YUNA 2, OH BOY
NOTE: still not 100% sure on "byuu" here, but i guess it's just meant to be an onomatopoeia for the whip's crack
NOTE: coined term, literally "flash-sky spear". i was going to call it the "heavensflash spear", but that would conflict with the "heaven" naming convention used for various enemies in this game.

column7: NOTE: not to be confused with a lightsaber

this is written as ライト・セイバー in concept art, which would be fractionally less legally dubious, but nope, it's one word here

column7: NOTE: these were all originally duplicates of the corresponding strings from longmap in the original game. since we've expanded those with translations of the text in the images, we don't want to use duplicates of them for the bonus menu, so they're deduplicated for the translation.

column6:
[#]1 -- Yuna Kagurazaka\n
The protagonist of this series, needless to say. Her personality is eternally happy-go-lucky. Though she's a bit dim at times, she protects the galaxy as the {Savior of Light.}

column5: 性格はおきらく　ごくらく

column6:
[#]2 -- Yuri\n
Appears in Yuna 2, and has fought alongside Yuna as her close friend since. She's honest and gentle, but she'll eat anything and everything.

column5: ユナの親友として共に戦う
すなおで優しいのだが

column6:
[#]3 -- Lia\n
Appears in Yuna 1, and, drawn in by Yuna's heart, becomes her close friend.\n
She has a serious personality, but under Yuna's influence, she's become somewhat more relaxed.

column5: ユナの心にひかれてユナの
多少　くだけてきた

column6:
[#]4 -- Erika Kousaka\n
Appears in Yuna 2.\n
A daughter of the Kousaka Conglomerate, she's extremely strong-minded and selfish, but is the object of great loyalty from her bodyguards, the Erika 7.

column5: 香坂財閥の令嬢で非常に
気が強く　わがままだが
親衛隊のエリカ７からの

column6:
[#]5 -- Misaki Ichijouin\n
Appears in The Sorrowful Siren.\n
Remains active as an investigator for the Galactic Union at present. She's cautious, but also has a tendency to stubbornly stick to an idea once it's in her head...
column7: NOTE: the licensed english release inexplicably calls this ova "siren's sorrow", which is an awkward translation at best. even the japanese trading cards, with all their dodgy translations and romanizations, at least call it "siren of sorrow"! this, together with factors like their absurd mess of a translation for "funny funny little girl", is one of the reasons i've chosen to ignore them and do things my own way.

column5: 査察官として活躍中である

column6:
[#]6 -- Mirage\n
Appears in Yuna 2.\n
She was a cruel being which schemed to destroy the Earth, but after feeling Yuna's warmth, her personality completely changed, and she became a steadfast ally.

column5: 地球破壊を企む冷酷な
存在だったが　ユナの
性格も一変し　頼もしい

column6:
[#]7 -- Ayako\n
Appears in Fairy of the Dark Abyss.\n
One of the Three Fey Machinae Sisters. Meeting Yuna, she realizes her own mistakes. She falls into her sister Genmu's hands and meets a sorrowful end.
column7: NOTE: the title of the second ova is "shinen no fairy", where "shinen" (abyss) is written with nonstandard kanji: 深闇 (deep darkness) instead of 深淵 (deep abyss)

column5: ユナに出会い　自分の
姉・幻夢の手に掛かり

column6:
[#]8 -- Kyouka\n
Appears in Fairy of the Dark Abyss.\n
The second oldest of the Three Fey Machinae Sisters, she attacked the Earth in order to wipe out Yuna. She is high-handed and confident.

column5: 妖機三姉妹の次女で　ユナ
抹殺のため地球に来襲する
性格は高飛車で自信家

column6:
[#]9 -- Genmu\n
Appears in Fairy of the Dark Abyss.\n
Eldest of the Three Fey Machinae Sisters. She holds power that towers above even the other Sisters, and is inhumanly cruel.

column5: 三姉妹の中でも抜きんでた
力を持ち　冷酷非道

column6:
[#]10 -- Machinate Emperor\n
Appears in this game.\n
A mysterious entity that rules over the Machinate Empire.\n
Using absolute power, she plots galactic destruction.

column5: 悪の機械化帝国を治める
絶対的な力を駆使して

[#]11 -- Pai Siang\n
Appears in this game.\n
A mysterious and beautiful girl who holds a hidden power.\n
Together with the Three Wise Machinae, she challenged the Machinate Emperor, but failed.

column5: 秘めたる力を持つ謎の

Appears in this game.\n
One of the Three Wise Machinae, she ruled over the former Machinate Empire as the White Emperor.

column6:

Appears in this game.\n
One of the Three Wise Machinae, and the right-hand man of the White Emperor.\n

Appears in this game.\n

Appears in this game.\n

Her power, aimed at obliteration, is shrouded in mystery.

Appears in this game.\n

column7: NOTE: just because i'd like to mention this somewhere: when presented in official materials, the youki sisters' names are sometimes written with chinese readings (possibly a retcon after they decided to have explicitly chinese names for all the other kikaikajin characters?). ayako is "Ya Ye Hu", kyouka is "Kwang Hua", and genmu is "Huan Mong". there's no real reason to have any of this in-game, though.

column7: NOTE: the enemy robot names and ranks are all a bit strange; i've dealt with them as best i can, but it's the kind of thing where if you handed them to someone else they'd probably come up with a completely different translation.

FIXME: there is probably some complicated story behind this robot's rank being indicated with a kanji referring specifically to the Huai River in China. unfortunately, i have no idea what it is.
NOTE: i'm kind of of two minds about how to translate 士 here; it can mean "samurai", but is also more generally used to indicate (members of) professions. the design of this robot's head appears to me to be evoking the eboshi samurai hat, so i've gone with "samurai" largely for that reason, but it's (as always) quite possible i'm entirely wrong.
NOTE: name of the npc pai siang that's used in her first appearance, and also the projector in the food planet mission

column7: NOTE: for unfathomable reasons, the programmer chose to optimize the status screen by using this same string to generate the regular attack label as well -- clip off the first character and you have it. this saves a whole seven bytes. and also really pisses me off because i now have to make new, separate strings for this and redirect the pointers to them. good job, programmer, i hope you feel accomplished.
NOTE: coined term, literally "gun attack machine"

NOTE: this is actually a japanese name for the mimosa plant, but for a trap which puts characters to sleep, the literal translation of "sleeping grass" is probably more helpful. also, it looks nothing like mimosa.
NOTE: used as part of a hack that replaces the "copy" part of the copy robots' names with a "C" so they can fit in the unit info box. not used in the translation.
FIXME: unknown use, i've played this game i don't even know how many times now and never found a situation where it comes up
